text.headline: Subliminal Traffic Control
text.text:
During the experiment, beacons on barrels were uniformly arranged x m apart along the workzone boundary in the simulator's virtual environment. Each subsequent beacon was initialized to flash off-on-off with a span of t s with respect to ground. This created an apparant wave pattern among the strobing light devices directed towards the oncoming vechicle (observer). None of the participants reported noticing the runway lights like pattern directed towards them in their exit survey. Each participant confirmed seeing a glowing beacon on the traffic barrels demarkating only one workzone - the static light condition workzone.

The particular wavelength or color of light from the virtual reality beacons was designed to be as close as possible to amber color of sodium vapor lamp warning beacons used as traffic control devices in North America and the UK. For the model however, the physical parameter of light's wavelength while passing through air, fog, car windshield and human eye was taken as a scalar "unit". This scalar quantity of 1 was appropriate for the model to account for the incident light on the driver's eyes as the "unit interaction layer" of electromagnetic spectrum suitably coupled to or entangled with their naked or aided human eye. Thus, in an abstract sense, each impinging spherical waveform, with its idiosyncrasies, couples to the optical sensor at unit area of incidence or cross section or hyperplane, along each conceivalbe dimensionality. The image on this page depicts projection of those hyperplanes from 4D of space and 0D of time into a convention of 3D of space and 1D of time. Coincidentally, identical visualizations are achieved when modeling thermodinamics of energy transductions or momenta transferences as well as communication of any message, medium and mode between a sender and a recipient.

Conjoined effects of spacetime curvature and eyebal curvature was approximated as height of drivers' eyes above ground level denoted by N. It was taken as an average height of 1.6 m for adult dirvers in a sedan. This serendipitously worked out very well for the model.

text.headline: Subliminal Traffic Control
text.text:
Within the model, the frequency of such discrete, light pulses incident on the observer is the "optical edge rate" E per s. It depends on the car's i.e. the eye balls' instant ground speed V2 in m/s "conjoined" with the pulsating light from beacons. The "ground" was simply the simulator's date-time function derived from its hapless electromechanical hardware along with "Windows OS + JVM + JRE + Tcl" stack.

This Rube Golderg Machine like experimental setup also generated every pixle of the virtual scene within the simulator. The scene would initalize once a key piece of the puzzle called "the anonymized human participant" could suitably place themselves into the setup after clearing their demographics survey.

text.headline: Subliminal Traffic Control
text.text:
The mathematical model shown in the image illustrates the significance of special relativity and ecology on human cognition using classical mechanics based optical phi phenomenon. Details available here: https://ir.uiowa.edu/etd/689/

The driving simulator based research indicated that drivers' understanding of their motion over ground could be alatered via pulses of light incident on their eyes' peripheral field of vision.

text.headline: Belief, Attitude & Action
text.text:
Driver's abrupt breaking or too rapid acceleration behavior (left hand graph) rectified subliminally using flashing lights on roadway markers (right hand graph). The participants drove for 45 mins on a 120 mile road with simulated highway workzone conditions at regular intervals. The conditions were designed to have synchronized or pseudo-random flashing lights and static lights on workzone markers.

A person could be made to believe they were driving around 70 km/h while driving at 50 km/h using a particular formulation of synchronized flashing lights within the simulator. Inducing a belief of moving at a much slower speed than the car's actual speed was also demonstrable. The word "actual" is used here in the context of the simulator's build.

The induced belief (and possibly subsequent change to assumed risk of conceived speed) had systematic correlations with drivers' actions in using break and accelerator pedals to maintain the car's actual driving speed. The outcome was that driving speed across almost all test participants was brought within the culturally prescribed range without the use of obtrusive signage, speed humps, police vehicles etc. in the simulator.

text.headline: SoRate Software & Services
text.text:
The enterprise cloud-based platform provided real-time business intelligence for Target Metric Point (TRP) rating of TV broadcast programs.

SoRate corellated realtime social media activity of all Turkish language users in Mediterranean region with their TV show viewership using the household's television set-top box i.e. media hub or router.

My contribution was in developing face recognition system for user behavior analysis. It used the optical and audio sensors of the media hub and screens connected for home television and internet bundle subscription. I was also the main business development and sales contact for SoRate in India and Bulgaria.

text.headline: BrightGuide Inc
text.text: CoFounded BrightGuide the company to help people with neurological injury or disease to go through daily activities by watching themselves in their motivating videos.

text.headline: BrightGuide Impact
text.text:
Trudy regained her ability to play the piano at age 92. She had been unable to do so since her hemorrhagic stroke in 2012.

Trudy still suffers from dementia-like symptoms with acute memory loss but continues to stay active by playing piano daily. She is able to age in place at Trinity Village, Kitchener by watching encouraging videos of herself.
